maml:description.maml:para: Get memory information from performance counters
Use this command to simplify the process of getting data from memory-related performance counters.

maml:Description.maml:para: Connect to a CimSession.
Enter the name of a computer to connect to.
Connect to a CimSession.
Enter the name of a computer to connect to.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Get-MemoryPerformance
AvailableBytes : 17207111680 AvailableKBytes : 16803820 AvailableMBytes : 16409 CacheBytes : 374910976 CacheBytesPeak : 627560448 CacheFaultsPersec : 6419 CommitLimit : 39345614848 CommittedBytes : 21974437888 DemandZeroFaultsPersec : 741 FreeAndZeroPageListBytes : 696127488 FreeSystemPageTableEntries : 12267190 LongTermAverageStandbyCacheLifetimes : 14400 ModifiedPageListBytes : 24715264 PageFaultsPersec : 7204 PageReadsPersec : 0 PagesInputPersec : 0 PagesOutputPersec : 0 PagesPersec : 0 PageWritesPersec : 0 PercentCommittedBytesInUse : 55 PoolNonpagedAllocs : 1182049 PoolNonpagedBytes : 559136768 PoolPagedAllocs : 1398128 PoolPagedBytes : 831823872 PoolPagedResidentBytes : 741318656 StandbyCacheCoreBytes : 155684864 StandbyCacheNormalPriorityBytes : 9012703232 StandbyCacheReserveBytes : 7342587904 SystemCacheResidentBytes : 374902784 SystemCodeResidentBytes : 0 SystemCodeTotalBytes : 0 SystemDriverResidentBytes : 12992512 SystemDriverTotalBytes : 29093888 TransitionFaultsPersec : 83 TransitionPagesRePurposedPersec : 0 WriteCopiesPersec : 0 DateTime : 11/21/2020 12:17:16 PM ComputerName : WIN10Desktop

dev:remarks.maml:para: Get all memory counters for the local computer.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Get-MemoryPerformance -Computername $c | Select Computername,%CommittedBytes*,AvailableMBytes,CacheBytes
Computername %CommittedBytesInUse AvailableMbytes CacheBytes ------------ -------------------- --------------- ---------- CHI-HVR1 7.05788756820636 14839 99377152 CHI-HVR2 16.8986961377323 13144 83001344 CHI-P50 24.753204334977 47143 94998528 CHI-DC04 47.8621563768474 1030 180101120 Win10-ENT-01 79.914213523203 1545 96137216

dev:remarks.maml:para: Get selected performance data from multiple computers defined in variable c.

maml:description.maml:para: Get a snapshot of memory usage.

This command will write a custom memory utilization object to the pipeline that indicates the current memory state. The criteria for what is normal or not is based on the $MemoryToolsOK and $MemoryToolsWarning global variable values. You can modify these values from the console.

maml:Description.maml:para: Connect using an existing CIMSession
Filter on a given status.
Specify the name of the computer or computers to query.
Filter on a given status.
Connect using an existing CIMSession
Specify the name of the computer or computers to query.
Filter on a given status.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Get-MemoryUsage -computername Thinkp1
Computername Status PctFree FreeGB TotalGB ------------ ------ ------- ------ ------- THINKP1 OK 83.66 26.39 32

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Get-MemoryUsage dom1,srv1,srv2,win10 -Status Warning
Computername Status PctFree FreeGB TotalGB ------------ ------ ------- ------ ------- WIN10 Warning 36.57 1.17 3

dev:remarks.maml:para: Get usage from several computers but filter and only display those with a Warning.

maml:description.maml:para: This command will query the Win32_PhysicalMemory class to get hardware details about installed memory. The command writes a custom object to the pipeline.

maml:Description.maml:para: Connect via an existing CimSession.
Specify the name of a computer or computers to query.
Connect via an existing CimSession.
Specify the name of a computer or computers to query.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Get-PhysicalMemory
Computername: PROSPERO
Manufacturer CapacityGB Form ClockSpeed Voltage Location ------------ ---------- ---- ---------- ------- -------- Crucial 32 SODIMM 2666 1200 ChannelA-DIMM0 Crucial 32 SODIMM 2666 1200 ChannelB-DIMM0

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Get-Physicalmemory -Computername thinkp1,prospero
Computername: THINKP1
Manufacturer CapacityGB Form ClockSpeed Voltage Location ------------ ---------- ---- ---------- ------- -------- Samsung 16 SODIMM 2667 1200 ChannelA-DIMM0 Micron 16 SODIMM 2667 1200 ChannelB-DIMM0
Computername: PROSPERO
Manufacturer CapacityGB Form ClockSpeed Voltage Location ------------ ---------- ---- ---------- ------- -------- Crucial 32 SODIMM 2666 1200 ChannelA-DIMM0 Crucial 32 SODIMM 2666 1200 ChannelB-DIMM0

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 3 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Get-Cimsession | Get-PhysicalMemory
Computername: WIN10
Manufacturer CapacityGB Form ClockSpeed Voltage Location ------------ ---------- ---- ---------- ------- -------- Microsoft Corporation 2 Unknown 0 0 M0001
Computername: SRV1
Manufacturer CapacityGB Form ClockSpeed Voltage Location ------------ ---------- ---- ---------- ------- -------- Microsoft Corporation 2 Unknown 0 0 M0001
Computername: DOM1
Manufacturer CapacityGB Form ClockSpeed Voltage Location ------------ ---------- ---- ---------- ------- -------- Microsoft Corporation 3.875 Unknown 0 0 M0001 Microsoft Corporation 4.125 Unknown 0 0 M0002

dev:remarks.maml:para: Pipe existing CIMSessions to the command. This example querying Hyper-V virtual machines so the results are a bit different.

maml:description.maml:para: Display processes using the most memory based on WorkingSet.

This command will use Get-CimInstance to retrieve the top processes by WorkingSet. It will retrieve the top 5 by default. The output will include a percentage of total in-use memory the process is using as well as the process owner.

maml:Description.maml:para: Connect via an existing CimSession.
The number of processes to retrieve. There is a maximum value of 25.
The name of a computer or computers to query.
The number of processes to retrieve. There is a maximum value of 25.
Connect via an existing CimSession.
The name of a computer or computers to query.
The number of processes to retrieve. There is a maximum value of 25.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Get-TopProcessMemory -top 1
Computername: PROSPERO
ProcessID : 3060 Name : powershell.exe WS(MB) : 1455.89 PctUsed : 4.8277 Owner : PROSPERO\Jeff Commandline : "C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe -Version 5.1 -s -NoLogo -NoProfile

dev:remarks.maml:para: Get the top process for the local computer.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Get-Cimsession | Get-TopProcessMemory | Sort Owner | Format-Table -GroupBy Owner -Property ProcessID,Name,WS,PctUsed
Owner: COMPANY\ArtD
Computername ProcessID Name WS PctUsed ------------ --------- ---- -- ------- WIN10 3520 powershell.exe 153464832 14.2925
Owner: NT AUTHORITY\SYSTEM
Computername ProcessID Name WS PctUsed ------------ --------- ---- -- ------- WIN10 2396 MsMpEng.exe 164093952 15.2824 WIN10 1400 svchost.exe 65187840 6.0711 WIN10 984 LogonUI.exe 55332864 5.1533 WIN10 1056 svchost.exe 47890432 4.4601

dev:remarks.maml:para: Use an existing CIMSession and get the top 5 processes. The output is sorted by the Owner property and formatted as a table.

maml:description.maml:para: Display a colorized version of memory usage.

This is a variation of the Get-MemoryUsage command. This version displays a colorized and formatted table using a custom view. Normal values will be displayed in green. Warnings will be displayed in yellow and Critical systems in red. The criteria for what is normal or not is based on the $MemoryToolsOK and $MemoryToolsWarning global variable values. You can modify these values from the console.

maml:Description.maml:para: Connect to an existing CimSession.
The name of a computer or computers to query.
Connect to an existing CimSession.
The name of a computer or computers to query.

dev:type.maml:name: This command creates a formatted table

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> show-memoryusage -Computername Dom1,Srv1,Srv2,Win10
**************** Memory Check ****************
Computername Status PctFree FreeGB TotalGB ------------ ------ ------- ------ ------- DOM1 OK 99.92 1023.2 1024 SRV1 OK 99.96 1023.63 1024 SRV2 OK 99.95 1023.51 1024 WIN10 Warning 36.89 1.19 3

dev:remarks.maml:para: The line for Win10 would be displayed in Yellow. The other computers would be displayed in Green.

maml:description.maml:para: Test if a computer meets a specific memory threshold.
This command can be used to test if memory utilization meets some criteria. There are several parameter sets for different tests. All of them can be used with -Quiet to return a simple Boolean value.

maml:Description.maml:para: Connect to an existing CimSession.
Suppress details and return a Boolean value.
Enter the minimum amount of used memory in GB

Enter the minimum % free memory
Suppress details and return a Boolean value.
Enter the minimum total memory in GB
Enter the minimum amount of used memory in GB

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 1 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Test-MemoryUsage
Computername PctFree Test ------------ ------- ---- BOVINE320 50.53 True

dev:remarks.maml:para: Run the default test on the local computer. The default percentage threshold is 50%.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 2 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Test-MemoryUsage -FreeGB 16
Computername FreeGB Test ------------ ------ ---- BOVINE320 15.93 False

dev:remarks.maml:para: Test if the computer has at least 16GB of free memory.
Test if the computer has at least 32GB of memory but only return True or False.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- Example 4 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code:
PS C:\> Test-MemoryUsage -UsedGB 20
Computername UsedGB Test ------------ ------ ---- BOVINE320 15.74 False

dev:remarks.maml:para: Test if the computer is using at least 20GB of memory.
